name: Edmund's Planet
description: A fictional planet appearing in the movie 'Interstellar'.

content.title: History
content.body: Edmund's Planet was one of the potential new home worlds explored by the crew of the Endurance spacecraft in 'Interstellar'. It was named after Dr. Wolf Edmunds, a scientist who was part of the original team sent to inhabit potential habitable planets.

content.title: Geography
content.body: The planet features rugged terrain with mountains and rock formations. It is bathed in natural daylight, suggesting a stable star system. It is mentioned to be similar to Earth in its capacity to support human life.

content.title: Notable Features
content.body: Edmund's Planet is known for its harsh landscape, making it a challenging environment for human habitation. It does not have any structures when first visited, as the initial mission was presumed lost.

content.title: Story Significance
content.body: In 'Interstellar', Edmund's Planet is significant as it becomes the final destination for humanity's colonization efforts. Dr. Brand chooses this planet to begin a new human colony, continuing the work that Edmunds started and fulfilling the mission's primary goal.
